title: Competence Management for Offshore Roles
content: Competence Assurance Systems verify individuals can reliably perform safety-critical tasks. Competence standards should link to MAH scenarios and key procedures. Training alone is insufficient—assess practical performance. Manage contractor competence through verification and oversight. Competence degrades without practice—maintain currency for infrequent safety-critical tasks.

scenario.story: A contractor arrives to perform well control equipment maintenance—a safety-critical task. What evidence of competence should be verified before issuing a permit?

options.B: Training certificates, practical assessment records, and recent experience on this equipment type
options.D: The contractor's supervisor vouches for them

scenario.explanation: Safety-critical task competence requires evidence of relevant training, assessed practical skills, and recent experience. Generic certificates and reputation don't demonstrate specific task competence.

openQuestions: How does your organization assess and maintain competence for safety-critical roles?
How is contractor competence verified before permitting safety-critical work?
